text: Code Quality: Essential Metrics To Track
Short Read: Clean as You Code, Donâ€™t Leave a Mess for Future You

Sometimes called the "scouts rule": leave things tidier than you found them. This rule can be dangerous with beginner programmers as they may "tidy up" a few functions by adding a lot of boilerplate style code, design patterns and other frivolities where YAGNI is often a more pertinent take.
